Uses of Interface
simulator.framework.TimeSensitive

Packages that use TimeSensitive
simulator.elevatorcontrol Contains classes that manipulate the simulated environmental objects. 
simulator.elevatormodules Provides sensors for detecting car position, door position, and door reversal triggers, and actuators for turning on button lights moving the doors. 
simulator.framework Provides the core infrastructure for simulating the network and elevator. 
simulator.framework.faultmodels   
simulator.payloads The message types that can be sent on the simulated network. 
 

Uses of TimeSensitive in simulator.elevatorcontrol
 

Classes in simulator.elevatorcontrol that implement TimeSensitive
 class DriveControl
          There is one DriveControl, which controls the elevator Drive (the main motor moving Car Up and Down).
 class SampleDispatcherMonitor
          This example monitor shows how to use the RuntimeMonitor hooks to check for fast speed between floors.
 class SamplePerformanceMonitor
          This monitoring class gives you a starting point for the performance checks you will do in project 7.
 

Uses of TimeSensitive in simulator.elevatormodules
 

Classes in simulator.elevatormodules that implement TimeSensitive
 class CarButtonLight
          implementation of the physical button and light The main purpose of this class is to provide an interface for the passenger objects.
 class CarWeightSensor
          Controls the weight alarm inside the car.
 class DoorMotor
          Models the doors of the elevator in the simulation.
 class DoorReversalSensor
          This module receives the framework reversals from the passengers and sends them on the network.
 class DriveObject
          Models the motion of the car in the simulation.
 class HallButtonLight
          implementation of the physical button and light The main purpose of this class is to provide an interface for the passenger objects.
 class Safety
          A safety certification node that looks for "dangerous" (as specified in the elevator requirements) operation of the elevator and sends an EmergencyBrakePayload message on the framework and network if such a condition is detected.
 

Uses of TimeSensitive in simulator.framework
 

Classes in simulator.framework that implement TimeSensitive
 class Controller
          The Controller object provides an abstract framework that you will use to build your distributed elevator controllers.
 class FaultInjector
          Responsible for creating and injecting fault objects as defined by the fault file (-ff).
 class MessageInjector
          This class is responsible for parsing mf files and creating the objects that do the actual message injections and assertion monitoring.
 class PassengerInjector
          Parses the -pf file and creates passenger objects accordingly.
 class ProgressLogger
          Prints out a log message periodically so that the simulator progress can be observed if no logging messages are being printed.
 class RuntimeMonitor
          This class provides a basic framework for implementing runtime monitors.

Uses of TimeSensitive in simulator.framework.faultmodels
 

Classes in simulator.framework.faultmodels that implement TimeSensitive
 class AbstractInterval
          Time interval utility superclass.
 class BERFaultModel
          Kills a message at exponentially distributed intervals with a mean of 1/inverseBitErrorRate.
 class BlackoutFaultModel
          Fault model that blocks all network traffic for a specified duration.
 class Interval
          Trivial interval implementation that doesn't do anything on events.
